metadata.dc:author: García Durán, Fernando
Tomás Moro, Esperanza
Rodríguez Agulló, José Luis
Bermejo San José, Fernando
Ciriza de Los Ríos, Constanza
Piqueras Alcol, Belén
Alvarez Sánchez, Jesús
Valer López-Fando, Paz
Carneros Martín, José Antonio
metadata.dc:description: Inflammatory cloacogenic polyps are infrequent lesions that usually arise in the anorectal zone. The most common clinical presentation is rectal bleeding. Two cases of rectal bleeding related to cloacogenic polyps with different endoscopic appearance are reported. Endoscopists should be familiar with this entity, which should be considered in the differential diagnosis with other polypoid lesions observed in colonoscopy.
metadata.dc:title: Pólipos inflamatorios cloacogénicos: una causa inusual de sangrado rectal.
[Inflammatory cloacogenic polyps: a rare cause of rectal bleeding].
